deteriorating, spoiling (as by rusting, decaying, etc.)

on the right side or direction (opposite of left)

up in the air, off the ground

moving or extending in space or time, variably translated by along, by, pass, here and there, etc.
moving or extending in space or time

night hawk (onomatopoeic root for bird's call)

intensifying element translated as very, much, strong, brave
1st plural personal pronoun exclusive, we, ours, us; i.e. he and I, they and I
moving to shore, going onto shore, away from the water, into the land

call, shout, or holler at someone
